isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER AUTOMATE-2 - TROUBLESHOOTING (ELECTRICAL) - CONFIRMING THE POWER SUPPLY AND TRANSMISSION CONTROLLER FUNCTIONS

svcproc.title: CONFIRMING THE POWER SUPPLY AND TRANSMISSION CONTROLLER FUNCTIONS

step1.para: Turn the key switch on. (Do not start the vehicle.)
If the transmission light comes on and then goes out, this signifies normal operation.
If the transmission light does not come on, check the bulb and both fuses. Refer to GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.

After confirming that the fuses and bulb are in good condition, check the Controller to Vehicle Wiring Harness. Unplug the J4 Connector and check with a multimeter. Check for 12 volts on pins 1 and 8, and check for ground on pins 14 and 15. If these do not occur, check the Controller to Vehicle Wiring Harness for any short or open circuits.

note.para: Do not short the specified pins to any other pins.
